Our proposed system is more secure and transparent than the traditional system. Its speed is also high compared to the traditional system because there is no need to a middleman in our system. The comparison between our proposed blockchain based banking system and traditional system depicts in Table  4.

A comprehensive analysis reveals distinct advantages of our blockchain-based system over traditional banking frameworks across several key performance indicators. In terms of transaction speed, while traditional domestic transfers can be instantaneous, cross-border payments often incur delays of days due to multiple intermediaries and reconciliation processes. Our system, leveraging blockchain, enables near-instantaneous cross-border settlements, significantly reducing latency. Regarding costs, traditional banking involves various fees (e.g., wire transfer fees, foreign exchange markups, intermediary charges), which can be substantial. Our system primarily incurs gas fees, which are often lower for direct peer-to-peer transfers, thereby reducing overall transaction expenses. From a security perspective, traditional systems, despite robust measures, remain susceptible to centralized database breaches and insider threats. Our blockchain-based system, with its cryptographic security, distributed ledger, and immutability, offers enhanced resilience against data tampering and unauthorized access. Transparency is another critical differentiator; traditional banking offers limited visibility into transaction flows, whereas our system provides a publicly verifiable and auditable record of all transactions on the blockchain. Finally, user control is significantly enhanced, as users maintain direct custody of their funds through their cryptographic keys, unlike traditional banking where funds are held by the institution.

In this performance benchmark, we have tested our smart contract's efficiency on Sepolia Ethereum Testnet. Sepolia has the features of the Ethereum Mainnet and is suitable for doing performance analysis. Unlike Mainnet, Sepolia Testnet uses the no-value token SepoliaETH to cover its gas fees. To relate the actual cost of a transaction, we compare the no-value token to the Mainnet's token, providing a clear view of the fees.

Throughput, gas cost, and latency are the key performance evaluation metrics. In our paper, these metrics represent the overall system's stability. In blockchain, throughput is the rate of transactions happening per second. This rate can be calculated by performing several transactions at a time over the difference between the EndTime (E) and StartTime (S) of the transactions in seconds. The formula for throughput is

Where the duration is calculated as

We need to divide the difference by 1000 to convert the time from milliseconds to seconds. A higher throughput means a much more efficient system. A system that can manage a huge number of transactions per second. Gas cost is the metric that determines the cost of every transaction. Which is another important factor to consider. Different functionality of smart contracts can consume different amounts of gas. The Gas cost is calculated by multiplying the gas consumed by the per-unit gas price.

We need to divide by \(10^{9}\) to convert Gwei to SepoliaEth \(\left( 1 \ \text {Gwei} = 10^{-9} \ \text {SepoliaEth} \right)\). Lower gas cost means a lower fee per transaction.

Gas cost analysis of proposed system.

On the other hand, Latency is what determines the time it takes to be included in the Blockchain for a single transaction. It's computed by taking the difference between the transaction confirmation time and the submission time for a single transaction. This provides a quick look at how fast the Blockchain is processing and validating transactions. Latency is expressed as

Using these metrics, this study aims to demonstrate the efficiency of the Blockchain by comparing it with its non-blockchain counterparts.

In our test, depicts in Fig.  9, we found that in the Sepolia Testnet, the Deposit, Transfer, and Withdrawl operations consume respectively 78,364, 41,667, and 61,207 gas units every time. For the Deposit, the Gas cost would be

every time. The same method can be used for Transfer and Withdraw. But as it is a Testnet, it doesn't carry real-world value.

In the traditional banking card system (e.g., Visa, American Express, Mastercard), the transaction cost is fixed and unrelated to the computational power. The merchant pays a fee of 1.5% to 3.5% of the total transaction's amount. The fee for a transaction increases as the amount increases.

On the Ethereum Mainnet, the cost of a transaction or a transaction fee is based on the computational power consumed by a transaction. For example, if we consider every deposit transaction on Mainnet with 78,364 consumed gas and at a gas price of 15 Gwei, then the cost for this transaction would be $4.11. Layer 2s would provide more efficiency on gas fees, ranging from $0.05 to $0.25 on every deposit transaction.

Latency analysis of proposed system.

Transaction throughput of proposed system.

From Fig.  10, if we look at the latency, the data retrieval from the blockchain is less than 1 second on average. Sepolia Testnet has a fixed block rate of 12 seconds, which means that every new block will be merged on the blockchain every 12 seconds, plus the time for the transaction to be picked up by a validator. We found that, on average, the deposit, transfer, and withdrawal take 16 seconds (Time to Inclusion) to write on the Testnet.

On the Ethereum Mainnet, the time to inclusion is similar to the Testnet and takes 12-25 seconds based on network congestion. However, the finality takes approximately 13 minutes. The layer 2s offer significantly less time to inclusion, but their finality is longer than that of layer 1.

For the traditional banking system, the execution time of transactions is also very fast, typically 2-3 seconds. However, this is only the approval of the bank. But the finality of the banking system takes up to 1-3 business days to completely transfer the funds among the banks.

TPS analysis of ethereum and traditional banking system.

The ability of a system to handle transactions is determined by its throughput, which is expressed in Transactions Per Second (TPS). The Ethereum Mainnet (Layer 1) and the Sepolia Testnet are intended to be identical, and both are subject to network consensus rules. Their throughput as shown in Fig.  11, which usually handles 15‚Äì30 TPS, is essentially constrained. This limits scalability but guarantees decentralization and security. Ethereum Layer 2s (such as Arbitrum and Optimism) overcome the limitations of Layer 1 and have the TPS ranging from 1,000 to 7,000.

By processing transactions off-chain and submitting compressed data to Layer 1, they achieve a dramatically higher throughput. For comparison, the traditional payment system represented by Visa's global network (VisaNet) is a highly optimized, centralized system. It sets the standard for high-volume transaction processing, designed for massive scale. This is based on the theoretical numbers of banking card systems, which claim 65,000 TPS for Visa and 5,000 for Mastercard, with their practical TPS ranging from 1300 to 2000 as shown in Fig.  12.

Our banking system, which is built on blockchain technology, introduces revolutionary concepts that fundamentally transform traditional banking procedures. By leveraging decentralized ledger technology, it ensures unparalleled transparency, security, and efficiency in financial transactions. The incorporation of smart contracts automates agreements, eliminates the need for intermediaries, and significantly reduces operational costs, providing users with a seamless banking experience.

In our innovative system, we offer a range of cutting-edge features designed to enhance user engagement and streamline banking operations:

Metamask connection We have developed a user-friendly button that allows users to effortlessly connect their Metamask accounts. This integration facilitates secure and direct interaction with the blockchain, empowering users to manage their digital assets efficiently.

Account interface The account interface serves as a comprehensive dashboard for users to monitor their financial activities. Through this interface, users can easily view their account balance, deposit and withdraw funds, and transfer ether from their account with just a few clicks. The intuitive design ensures that even those new to blockchain technology can navigate the system with ease.

All account interface This section provides users with visibility into all accounts that interact with our banking system. Users can not only view the transaction history of each account but also track their own transactions, fostering a sense of accountability and trust within the community.

Enhancing security Our method transforms financial security by utilizing blockchain technology. Using a distributed ledger, each transaction is tracked as a block that is connected to the one before it to create an unchangeable chain. Because there is no longer a need for middlemen, there is less chance of fraud and data breaches. Furthermore, our utilised blockchain uses cryptographic encryption to protect private data, guaranteeing its secrecy and integrity. Smart contracts automate procedures, reduce errors, and boost productivity. They are self-executing contracts with predetermined terms. Moreover, the consensus method makes it very difficult to falsify or alter the data because it requires several nodes to validate transactions. This coordinated effort guarantees the highest level of security for banking transactions while fortifying the system's resistance to hackers. While the system is designed to be highly resistant to common cyberattacks due to its decentralized and cryptographic nature, it is important to note that no system is entirely immune. Potential vulnerabilities could arise from smart contract bugs, user private key compromise, or sophisticated social engineering attacks, necessitating continuous security audits and user education.

Our system's data is securely stored on the Alchemy Sepolia Testnet, allowing users to scrutinize every transaction's hash value, block number, date, transaction amount, gas fees, and other relevant details. This feature underscores the transparency of our system, as users can verify each transaction independently.

Moreover, the architecture of the Sepolia Testnet ensures that no one can alter transaction data once it has been recorded. This immutability is a cornerstone of our banking system, providing users with confidence that their financial data remains secure and unchangeable. The combination of transparency and immutability not only enhances user trust but also sets a new standard for how banking systems can operate in a digital age.

Through these advancements, our blockchain-based banking system is poised to redefine the landscape of financial services, making banking more accessible, efficient, and secure for all users.

A smart contract-based transaction solution for Blockchain-based transaction processes is being presented by this project. This guarantees that the funds of users are protected by our system and that there will never be any financial loss. Compared to the previous manually operated transaction applications, such as bank transactions, this is an upgrade. Transactions in a variety of sectors can be made quick, safe, immutable, decentralized, fraud-free, and transparent with Ethereum-based transaction systems. Because it can meet the demands of the impending cashless economy, the banking sector can fully rely on this technology in the future. Finance firms will use decentralized finance, which eliminates the need for investors to deposit their money with a central bank.

This work represents a proof-of-concept and should not be interpreted as a production-ready banking platform. The results, while promising, are based on a limited deployment on a test network and without integration with real financial infrastructures. Future work will focus on extending the platform with mobile payment integration, third-party login mechanisms, enhanced security auditing of smart contracts, and usability testing with end-users. Specifically, future work will involve developing native iOS and Android mobile applications with features like biometric authentication and push notifications, integrating decentralized identity solutions (e.g., Verifiable Credentials) for robust KYC/AML compliance, conducting formal verification and continuous security audits of smart contracts, and performing extensive user studies to refine the user experience. Furthermore, rigorous performance benchmarks will be established to measure transaction throughput (TPS) and latency under various load conditions, and strategies for interoperability with existing traditional financial APIs will be explored to facilitate real-world adoption. A real-world pilot with measurable performance benchmarks and user studies will be required before deploying such systems in practical financial services environments.

While our blockchain framework demonstrates potential for secure and transparent financial transactions, several limitations exist. First, the system was only tested in a controlled testnet environment and not connected to real banking APIs or financial institutions. This implies that the system's performance under real-world network congestion, variable gas prices, and regulatory compliance requirements remains untested. Second, the evaluation lacks formal benchmarks for speed, throughput, or fault tolerance. Third, the system does not include features like mobile application support, user identity verification (KYC), or audit compliance mechanisms necessary for real-world deployment. The absence of these features means the current prototype cannot address critical aspects of user onboarding, anti-money laundering regulations, or financial reporting standards required for practical banking operations. These limitations will be addressed in future iterations of the work. Ultimately, the vision for this research is to contribute to a future where blockchain technology serves as a foundational layer for a truly inclusive, efficient, and secure global financial ecosystem, moving beyond theoretical concepts to practical, impactful implementations19,20,21.

No datasets were generated or analyzed during the current study. The system was evaluated through simulated tasks on a prototype deployed on the Ethereum Sepolia Testnet. Therefore, there is no raw data to share. However, the prototype source code and smart contract implementation are available from the corresponding author upon reasonable request.

Title: Fishing Frenzy Unveils $FISH Whitepaper
Description:
Fishing Frenzy has recently announced the introduction of the $FISH token through a detailed whitepaper. This token is an ERC20-C token developed specifically for use within the Fishing Frenzy game ecosystem. Alongside $FISH, there is a non-tradable token, $xFISH, intended specifically for internal rewards and managing the game's economic activities.

The $FISH token brings a novel ‚ÄúProof of Contribution‚Äù system where players gain rewards not just through gameplay but also by engaging substantially with the game community and its economy. Players can use $FISH for various in-game functions, including the purchase of premium content, access to new gaming modes, and upkeep of essential in-game equipment. An exciting feature is the ‚Äúdiving‚Äù game mode which incorporates a noticeable risk-reward element to gameplay.

Moreover, $FISH holders have the option to stake their tokens to accrue ‚ÄúKarma‚Äù‚Äîa measured metric reflecting a player's contribution to the broader game community and economy. Accumulating Karma enables players to enjoy additional benefits such as a share of revenue from game acquisitions, reduced fees, and other advantages that correlate with their level of engagement.

The total supply of $FISH tokens is capped at 1 billion, shared between $FISH and $xFISH, all circulating on the Ronin network. A large portion of these tokens is dedicated to building the community and incentivizing growth. The release of these tokens is scheduled over a period, linked to specific market performance milestones which encourage sustained engagement from participants. At launch, about 27.5% of the total supply will be made available, with further releases planned over a 24-month period.

The Karma system is central to the $FISH economy, providing a framework that rewards not just for playing the game, but also for contributing to liquidity, performing in-game transactions, and engaging with the community. Players with high Karma scores can unlock numerous benefits that improve their overall gaming experience and potential earnings, making the economy geared toward rewarding meaningful, long-term participation.

Fishing Frenzy serves as a rich RPG on the Ronin network, combining traditional gaming elements with innovative web3 functionalities. With over 10 million installations and significant daily activity, Fishing Frenzy utilizes blockchain technology to empower a dynamic, player-driven economy. It includes various interactive elements such as fishing, cooking, and trading, all within a community-focused framework.

The game is accessible for free via web browsers, providing an easy entry point to blockchain-based gaming. The development team actively incorporates player feedback to continually evolve and enhance the gaming environment, with further expansions planned, including mobile versions.

In summary, Fishing Frenzy is pioneering the blend of traditional gaming with blockchain advancements, setting new standards for future developments in the web3 domain.

Title: Prospector Announces Additional Non-Brokered Private Placements
Description:
NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION TO U.S. NEWSWIRE SERVICES FOR DISSEMINATION IN THE UNITED STATES

Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - November 7, 2025) - Prospector Metals Corp. PPP (OTCQB: PMCOF) (FSE: 1ET) ("Prospector" or the "Company") today announced it has arranged a non-brokered private placement to raise gross proceeds of up to $27,658,351 through the issuance of 5,500,000 flow-through common shares (the ‚ÄúFT Shares‚Äù) at a price of $1.00 per FT Share and 22,843,661 non-flow-through common shares (the ‚ÄúNFT Shares‚Äù) at a price of $0.97 per NFT Share(the ‚ÄúOffering‚Äù).

In connection with the offering of the NFT Shares, Alpayana S.A.C. ("Alpayana") has agreed to subscribe for an aggregate of 14,631,283 NFT shares. Upon completion of the Offering, Alpayana will have aggregate beneficial ownership and control over approximately 9.9% of the issued and outstanding common shares of the Company.

In addition; 1) the Company's largest shareholder, B2Gold Corp. has agreed to exercise an aggregate of 2,133,636 outstanding warrants and subscribe for an additional 7,181,451 NFT shares, in addition to its previously announced subscription for 10,309,278 common shares, bringing its strategic investment in the Company on closing of the Offering to 29,410,357 common shares representing 19.9 % of the issued and outstanding shares of the Company; and 2) an investment group led by John Robins of Discovery Capital have agreed to subscribe for 6,500,000 total shares.

Rob Carpenter, CEO and Director of Prospector, said: "Prospector welcomes the support of Alpayana, along with the Gubbins family, with this timely investment to accelerate advancing our ML project. The Company is also appreciative of the increased investment from B2Gold, who believe in the strong exploration potential of the ML project."

John Robins, Advisor and Principal of Discovery Capital Ltd, said: "It's a pleasure to be working closely again with Dr Rob Carpenter. Our last venture led to the discovery of over 5 million ounces of gold at the Coffee project south of Dawson city YT. Under Rob's leadership Prospector is poised to be the Yukon's next big gold discovery."

The flow-through shares will qualify as flow-through shares (within the meaning of Subsection 66(15) of the Income Tax Act (Canada). An amount equal to the gross proceeds from the issuance of the flow-through shares will be used to incur eligible resource exploration expenses which will qualify as: (i) Canadian exploration expenses (as defined in the tax act); and (ii) as flow-through critical mineral mining expenditures (as defined in Subsection 127(9) of the tax act). Qualifying expenditures in an aggregate amount not less than the gross proceeds raised from the issue of the flow-through shares will be incurred (or deemed to be incurred) by the company on or before Dec. 31, 2026, and will be renounced by the company to the initial purchasers of the flow-through shares with an effective date no later than Dec. 31, 2025.

Prospector intends to use the proceeds of the FT Shares to finance its exploration program at its ML project in Yukon, which includes up to 5,000 metres of diamond drilling focused on five target areas, as reported in the company's news release dated April 9, 2025, and the proceeds of the NFT Shares for additional funding of its exploration program at the ML project and for general working capital purposes.

There are no finder's fees or commissions payable in connection with the Offering. The offering is subject to certain closing conditions, including, but not limited to, the receipt of all necessary approvals, including the conditional approval of the TSX Venture Exchange.

The securities issued under the offering will be subject to a hold period under applicable securities laws in Canada expiring four months and one day from the closing date of the offering.

This news release does not constitute an offer to sell or a solicitation of an offer to buy any securities in the United States. The securities have not been and will not be registered under the United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "U.S. Securities Act") or any state securities laws and may not be offered or sold within the United States or to U.S. Persons unless registered under the U.S. Securities Act and applicable state securities laws or an exemption from such registration is available.

About Prospector Metals Corp.

Prospector Metals Corp. is a proud member of Discovery Group. The Company is focused on district scale, early-stage exploration of gold and base metal prospects. Creating shareholder value through new discoveries, the Company identifies underexplored or overlooked mineral districts displaying important structural and mineralogical occurrences similar to more established mining operations. The majority of acquisition activity occurs in Yukon and Ontario, Canada ‚Äì Historical mining jurisdictions with an abundance of overlooked geological regions possessing high mineral potential. Prospector establishes and maintains relationships with local and Indigenous rightsholders and seeks to develop partnerships and agreements that are mutually beneficial to all interested parties.

On behalf of the Board of Directors,

Prospector Metals Corp.

Dr. Rob Carpenter, Ph.D., P.Geo.

President & CEO

For further information about Prospector Metals Corp. or this news release, please visit our website at prospectormetalscorp.com or contact Prospector at 1-778-819-5520 or by email at info@prospectormetalscorp.com.

Prospector Metals Corp. is a proud member of Discovery Group. For more information, please visit: discoverygroup.ca.

Consequently, there can be no assurances that such statements will prove to be accurate and actual results and future events could differ materially from those anticipated in such statements. Title: Olderfall Season 1 Launches
Description:
Olderfall Season 1 is live, offering NFT Fallens, in-game gear, and weekly USDC tournaments. Free to play on Polygon, the game combines PvP, PvE, and web3 rewards.

Eliza Crichton-Stuart

Updated Nov 7, 2025

Olderfall, a web3 auto battler on Polygon, has officially kicked off its first season. The game is available on both browser and Android, allowing players to start without a crypto wallet and immediately collect, train, and battle with their gladiators, known as Fallens. Season 1 introduces a 60-day Battle Pass, rotating PvE challenges, and weekly tournaments with USDC prize pools for competitive players.

At its core, Olderfall is a tactical auto-battler where success depends on team composition and strategy rather than in-battle control. Players begin by signing up with Gmail at play.olderfall.com and receive a free Fallen to start their journey. Each Fallen is generated with unique stats, styles, and battle affinities, which factor into both PvP and PvE engagements.

Combat consumes energy, with each match using 10 points and 100 points available per day. Energy regenerates incrementally every five minutes. Players can test their setups in PvP matches or explore the weekly Rotating Battle Tower, which adjusts difficulty and rewards over time. The game also features Vitrium as its main in-game currency, which can be earned through PvE, used to upgrade gear, and integrated into the upcoming crafting system.

Season 1's Battle Pass is active until November 21, offering both free and premium tracks. Players can earn rewards by participating in Deathmatches, the Battle Tower, and tournaments. The pass includes NFT Fallens, booster chests, weapons and armor of varying rarities, and Vitrium. Some premium items are already seeing secondary market activity, with certain weapons and armor NFTs being traded for significant value.

The Battle Pass is designed to be accessible to all players. No wallet is required to begin earning, and in-game progression ensures regular play is rewarded without immediate financial investment.

The season also introduces two factions through NFT collections: the Hollow Court, representing vampires, and the Verdant Kin, representing elves. Each faction comes with passive skills that tie into a visual day/night cycle. Hollow Court units gain a damage bonus at night, while Verdant Kin units receive the same bonus during the day. Players can experiment with both factions, adjusting strategies based on time and team composition.

For players looking to compete for real-world rewards, Olderfall offers weekly N3MUS tournaments. These include two formats: the N3MUS Weekly Tournament, running from Wednesday to Wednesday with a $500 prize pool, and the Quick Play Tournament, held every Friday with a $250 prize pool. Top performers in each bracket receive a share of the prizes.

Registration requires linking the in-game account to n3mus.com using the same Gmail login. Players must enter their in-game wallet manually to be eligible for USDC prizes. Across the four-week season, these tournaments provide roughly $3,000 in total rewards.

The Battle Tower offers weekly rotations of PvE challenges, scaling difficulty and rewards to provide an ongoing source of Vitrium and loot. This mode is now the primary method for acquiring Vitrium, as Deathmatches focus on XP and leaderboard points.

In addition to official tournaments, olderfall includes internal Flex Tournaments that reward XP, Vitrium, and gear. These events are organized by level ranges, allowing players to test and refine their strategies in a lower-stakes environment.

Olderfall supports NFTs beyond character units, including weapons, armor, and pets, all of which can be upgraded and traded. A future crafting system will allow players to enhance gear by merging or melting items. While NFTs can provide advantages in battle, they are not required to participate or progress, as daily play allows players to earn all essential resources.

Olderfall is developed by Anubika, a web3 game studio with extensive experience in digital product development and blockchain gaming. The team spent two years building Olderfall before launch, ensuring it was fully playable without a commercial requirement. A native token called $AURE is planned for the future to support crafting, tournament entries, and other gameplay systems.

Season 1 concludes on November 21. This is the final opportunity to earn the first wave of NFT Fallens, gear, and Battle Pass rewards. Players can start by visiting play.olderfall.com, signing in with Gmail, and beginning their first battles immediately, without needing a crypto wallet.

What is Olderfall?Olderfall is a free-to-play web3 auto battler on Polygon where players collect NFT Fallens, equip them with gear, and engage in strategic PvP and PvE battles.

How do I start playing Olderfall?Players can start by signing in with a Gmail account at play.olderfall.com. A free Fallen is provided at the beginning, and no crypto wallet is required.

What rewards are available in Season 1?Season 1 offers a Battle Pass with NFT Fallens, weapons, armor, booster chests, Vitrium, and cosmetic items. Some items in the premium track are already being traded on secondary markets.

How do the weekly USDC tournaments work?Weekly N3MUS tournaments provide real USDC prizes. Players must register through n3mus.com and link their in-game wallet. Prizes are distributed based on ranking in each tournament bracket.

Do I need to buy NFTs to play?No. All essential resources and characters can be earned through regular gameplay, although NFTs can enhance performance and be traded.

What is Vitrium?Vitrium is the main in-game currency in Olderfall. It is used to upgrade gear and participate in upcoming crafting systems.

When does Season 1 end?Season 1 ends on November 21, 2025, marking the final opportunity to earn current Battle Pass rewards.Meta Title: Olderfall Season 1 Launches on Polygon with Weekly USDC Tournaments

Title: Japan's Megabanks Prepare Launch Of Yen-Backed Stablecoin
Description:
Japan's largest financial institutions are advancing plans to introduce a yen-backed stablecoin, signaling a coordinated shift toward regulated digital currency infrastructure that could transform domestic and cross-border payments. Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), Mizuho Financial Group, and Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG) are aligning with Japan's evolving digital finance policy framework to deploy the asset in a compliant and institutionally supported environment.

The initiative comes as Japan's Finance Ministry and the Financial Services Agency (FSA) indicate readiness to support stablecoins issued under regulated conditions. Japan revised its Payment Services Act to allow licensed institutions, including banks and trust companies, to issue stablecoins fully backed by fiat currency. This move established a clear regulatory foundation aimed at mitigating risks associated with private or unregulated token issuers.

MUFG is expected to leverage its Progmat platform as the technical foundation for issuance and token management. Progmat was originally developed to support tokenized securities and has since expanded to accommodate stablecoin issuance features that meet Japan's strict compliance standards. This infrastructure is designed to enable settlement, clearing, and asset transfer in a secure, transparent environment.

The planned stablecoin will initially be pegged to the Japanese yen, offering a digital payment instrument that maintains 1:1 redemption value. However, the megabanks are also evaluating the possibility of issuing a dollar-denominated version designed to streamline international trade transactions. Cross-border settlements remain costly and time-consuming due to intermediary reliance in traditional banking systems, and the banks see stablecoins as a strategic tool to reduce settlement risks and accelerate transaction velocities.

Industry analysts expect early adoption to center on corporate clients, particularly exporters, multinational supply chains, and financial institutions conducting frequent high-value transfers. The stablecoin could reduce friction in invoicing, settlement, and treasury operations by enabling real-time exchange and automated accounting integration. If successful, the technology could expand into broader financial services segments, including trade finance and wholesale lending markets.

The megabank initiative enters a market where privately issued digital yen tokens are gaining traction. Startups such as JPYC have already introduced yen-linked digital assets, attracting early adopters in online commerce and Web3 ecosystems. However, the forthcoming bank-issued stablecoin benefits from institutional credibility, regulated reserve backing, and integrated banking system access, which may appeal more strongly to corporate and financial sector users.

Industry observers suggest that the launch could influence international policy discussions around central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) and regulated stablecoins. Japan has been testing CBDC models through the Bank of Japan but has not yet committed to national issuance. The megabank-backed stablecoin may function as a parallel or complementary mechanism depending on future policy direction.

As pilot testing and regulatory evaluation move forward, a formal launch timeline has not yet been announced. However, the scale and coordination of the project suggest that Japan may soon become a leading example of how traditional financial institutions can incorporate blockchain-based settlement into mainstream economic infrastructure.

Title: Institutional Embrace Meaningful to Crypto's Future
Description:
Produced by








Experienced cryptocurrency investors know that when bitcoin and the asset class at large were younger that it was largely the territory of retail traders and speculators. Fortunately, crypto has grown up quite a bit. That maturation process has been helped in part by spot ETFs like the Coinshares Valkyrie Bitcoin Fund (BRRR ).

It's been almost two years since the first spot bitcoin ETFs debuted in the U.S. And those products, including BRRR, broadened bitcoin's domestic investor base. That has allowed more RIAs and retail investors to comfortably access the largest digital currency. However, those aren't the only signs of broadening crypto adoption and maturation.

In what could be a long-term plus for ETFs such as BRRR, institutional adoption of digital currencies is increasing. And that theme is believed to be in its early innings. It includes companies adding major cryptocurrencies ‚Äî namely bitcoin and ethereum ‚Äî to their balance sheets as an alternative to cash.

‚ÄúFor corporations, this opened the door to a new kind of treasury management. Bitcoin began to serve as a reserve asset ‚Äî functionally comparable in purpose to holdings such as gold or short-term Treasuries. As of October 2025, listed firms collectively held around one million BTC, with many more held privately or in sovereign reserves,‚Äù according to CoinShares.

Long-term investors considering assets such as BRRR are rightfully inquisitive about the trajectory of institutional crypto adoption. Fortunately, the news has been broadly encouraging. For example, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) in 2023 altered guidelines for treatment of crypto on corporate balance sheets, allowing those holdings to be gauged at fair value, as is the case with other securities held be companies.

That removed a roadblock to corporate ownership of digital currencies. That change has opened the floodgates of corporations' embrace of cryptocurrency. Some are even going so far as to participate in the building of cryptocurrency networks.

‚ÄúBanks, asset managers and fintech firms are beginning to build on networks like Ethereum, Solana, Avalanche and Sui, which provide fast, transparent and interoperable settlement layers. These programmable networks enable near-instant transactions, on-chain collateralisation and automated compliance,‚Äù added CoinShares.

Of note to investors considering ETFs like BRRR is that corporate adoption of major digital currencies like bitcoin and ethereum is becoming a lead, follow, or get out of the way proposition. That could be a sign of long-term momentum.

‚ÄúInstitutions that adapt early will shape the standards and systems that define this next era. Those that wait will find themselves operating in a world where finance itself, not just money, has become programmable,‚Äù concluded CoinShares.

For more news, information, and strategy, visit the CoinShares Crypto ETF Hub.

You can unsubscribe at any time.

Title: Stablecoins and the New Currency Cold War
Description:
Opinion

Stablecoins like Tether are reshaping global finance‚Äîexpanding dollar access, challenging banks, and testing U.S. dominance in a shifting digital economy.

Last week, Tether, the world's largest dollar-backed stablecoin, claimed it had reached 500 million users. That figure, while hard to verify, reflects a growing reality: in countries like Argentina, Nigeria, and Turkey, people are turning to digital dollars not to speculate, but to survive. Inflation eats away at savings, banks are unreliable or inaccessible, and local currencies often fail to hold value. In these places, stablecoins offer a lifeline.

What started as a niche experiment in cryptocurrency has grown into a $300 billion market. That's larger than the GDP of many countries. Stablecoins now serve as a kind of shadow dollar system, operating outside traditional banking channels. They settle transactions in seconds, run 24/7, and offer transparency through public blockchains. In regions where correspondent banking networks are shrinking, these tokens fill a critical void.

Optimists believe stablecoins could replace legacy payment systems within a decade. That's not just a technical shift - it's a geopolitical one. The United States has taken notice. In July, President Trump signed the GENIUS Act, a law that regulates ‚Äúpayment stablecoins‚Äù and requires issuers to hold reserves in high-quality assets like Treasury bills. It also gives holders priority in case of insolvency. The goal is clear: to reinforce demand for U.S. Treasuries and preserve the dollar's role as the world's reserve currency.

But the dollar's dominance is no longer guaranteed. Its share of global central bank reserves has dropped to 56 percent, the lowest in 30 years when adjusted for currency fluctuations. Sanctions on Russia have pushed countries to explore alternatives, including China's CIPS payment system. SWIFT still handles most cross-border transactions in dollars, but its grip is weakening. Stablecoins, by contrast, extend dollar access to the unbanked and underbanked, potentially locking in U.S. influence in places where traditional banking has failed.

Still, the strategy has cracks. The idea that stablecoins will drive massive demand for U.S. Treasuries is shaky. Tether holds around $130 billion in short-term Treasury bills - just 2 percent of the total market. Even if the stablecoin sector doubles, it would still only absorb short-term debt. The long-term funding that Washington relies on comes from central banks and allied governments. There is little evidence that stablecoins are replacing these traditional buyers. 

There's also a risk that the Treasury could become too dependent on short-term debt. Issuing more bills might save money in the short run, but it increases rollover risk. These instruments mature quickly, requiring constant refinancing. If interest rates spike or markets panic - as they did in March 2020 - the government could face a liquidity crunch at the worst possible time.



And then there's the question of stability. Stablecoins are essentially digital IOUs, backed by reserves that users must trust. That trust can evaporate quickly. In October, Ethena's USDe, the third-largest stablecoin, dropped to 65 cents during a wave of liquidations. It recovered, but only after hours of chaos. Holders of these tokens don't have senior claims in bankruptcy. They're unsecured creditors. Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey has warned about the risk of ‚Äúdigital bank runs‚Äù and the lack of transparency in reserves. The IMF has echoed those concerns, urging caution as stablecoins gain traction.

For developing countries, the risks are even greater. Dollar stablecoins could trigger a new wave of dollarization, similar to what Latin America experienced in the 1980s or Asia in the late 1990s. When the Federal Reserve raises interest rates, local currencies weaken, and the economic pain deepens. Governments lose control over their monetary policy, becoming beholden to decisions made in Washington.

The GENIUS Act may bring regulatory clarity in the U.S., but many stablecoin issuers operate in legal gray zones abroad. Security flaws remain a concern - hacks, phishing attacks, and lost keys are common. Even central bank digital currency pilots have struggled to move beyond limited trials and speculative use.

Tether's reach is enormous. With $182 billion in circulation and annual profits approaching $15 billion, it has become a major player in global finance. It offers financial inclusion in places where banks won't go. But by outsourcing dollar access to private companies, the U.S. is tying its currency to their fortunes. That means exposure to market volatility, regulatory uncertainty, and the risk of sudden collapses.

Washington is betting that digital dollars will reinforce its global position. JPMorgan estimates that stablecoins could generate $1.4 trillion in added demand by 2027. But history offers plenty of cautionary tales. Easy money often ends in crisis. Stablecoins may represent American innovation, but they also expose vulnerabilities in the financial system.

This is the paradox of our time. Tools that empower individuals and nations can also deepen dependence on U.S. policy and reveal weaknesses at home. If stablecoins are governed wisely, they could reshape how the dollar functions in the world. If not, they may slowly undermine it. The choice lies with Washington - and with the rest of the world watching closely.

Imran Khalid is a physician, geostrategic analyst, and freelance writer.

 A young man confronts federal agents after they arrested a worker at a home in his Edison Park neighborhood on October 31, 2025, in Chicago, Illinois. Agents gave him two warnings and threatened to arrest him for interfering with their operation during President Donald Trump's administration's "Operation Midway Blitz," an ongoing immigration enforcement surge across the Chicago region

In the middle of the night, on September 30, a federal military-style assault was deployed on a civilian apartment building in Chicago's South Shore district. Without warning or warrants, residents of the complex, mostly U.S. citizens of color, many of them children, were forcibly taken from their homes, zip-tied, and detained for hours.

 ‚ÄúThey just treated us like we were nothing,‚Äù Pertissue Fisher, a U.S. citizen and one of the residents victimized in the onslaught, told ABC News. She said she was handcuffed, held for hours, and released around 3:00 a.m. She said this was the first time a gun was ever put to her face. 







































A "for sale" sign in the area where the Austin, Texas-based group BorderPlex plans to build a $165 billion data center in Santa Teresa, New Mexico.

Sunland Park, New Mexico, is not a notably online community. Retirees have settled in mobile homes around the small border town, just over the state line from El Paso. Some don't own computers ‚Äî they make their way to the air-conditioned public library when they need to look something up.

Soon, though, the local economy could center around the internet: County officials have approved up to $165 billion in industrial revenue bonds to help developers build a sprawling data center campus just down the road.























































































The financial markets have a way of reminding us that complacency is a luxury we cannot afford. On October 16, the three major U.S. stock indexes all closed lower, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropping 0.7 percent, the S&P 500 falling 0.6 percent, and the Nasdaq Composite declining 0.5 percent. This downturn came amid growing unease over loan problems at regional banks, compounded by lingering trade tensions that have already strained investor sentiment. The VIX index, often called Wall Street's fear gauge, surged to close at 25.31, its highest level since April 24. That spike in volatility reflects a deeper anxiety: the possibility that isolated credit issues are symptoms of broader weaknesses in the banking system.

Consider Zions Bancorporation, a regional lender whose shares plunged 13 percent that day after it disclosed unexpected losses on two loans in its California division. The bank announced a $50 million charge-off tied to alleged fraud by a borrower, prompting it to set aside an additional $60 million provision for credit losses. Western Alliance Bancorp faced similar scrutiny, with its stock dropping more than 10 percent after revealing fraud in one of its loans. These revelations sent ripples through the sector, dragging down the SPDR S&P Regional Banking ETF by over 6 percent and affecting even larger players like Jefferies Financial Group, whose shares fell 9 percent. Alternative asset managers, including Blue Owl Capital and Ares Management, also saw declines as investors questioned the health of private credit portfolios.



















American flag and money

We all want an America where hard work pays, families thrive, and the American Dream is real again. Greatness starts with dignity for workers, safety for communities, and a fair shot for every kid. The promise is simple: if you put in the work, you should be able to raise a family and get ahead‚Äîperiod.

So why do we cling to what is obviously not working for everyday people?

Title: Crypto Casinos Bet Big: 099.vip's Upgrade Signals a New Era for Online Gaming
Description:
November 7, 2025 ‚Äì The online gaming landscape is undergoing a revolutionary transformation, driven by the burgeoning rise of cryptocurrency casinos. Today, platforms like 099.vip are at the forefront of this shift, with 099.vip announcing a significant upgrade to its cryptocurrency casino, signaling a maturing market that promises enhanced privacy, security, and user experience. This development underscores a broader trend where blockchain technology and digital currencies are not just integrating into, but actively redefining, the online gambling industry.

The immediate reaction from the crypto community and industry observers is one of keen interest, highlighting the ongoing evolution of Web3 applications. This matters immensely for the crypto ecosystem as it not only drives increased adoption and utility for various digital assets but also pushes the boundaries of decentralized finance (DeFi) and provably fair gaming, setting new standards for transparency and trust in a traditionally opaque sector. The continuous innovation in this space is attracting a new generation of tech-savvy users and reshaping how value is exchanged and games are played online.

The economic implications of cryptocurrency casinos are profound, creating a distinct economic model that benefits both players and operators. For players, the appeal lies in enhanced privacy, as transactions can be conducted pseudonymously, bypassing the need to disclose sensitive personal banking information. This is coupled with significantly lower transaction fees, particularly for international transfers, and faster payouts compared to traditional banking systems. For operators, these advantages translate into reduced operational costs, less reliance on intermediaries, and often lower licensing fees, leading to higher profit margins. The industry's growth also stimulates demand for specialized talent in blockchain development and security.

Cryptocurrency casinos are rapidly carving out a substantial market share within the global online gaming industry. The market, which surged from $50 million in 2019 to an estimated $250 million in 2024, is projected to continue its exponential growth, potentially reaching $400 million by 2028 and accounting for up to 47% of the global online gambling market by 2027. In the first three quarters of 2024, approximately 17% of all iGaming bets were placed using cryptocurrency, showcasing a robust increase even as fiat betting grew. Companies like Stake.com have emerged as dominant players, holding over half the market share among major crypto casinos and processing billions in monthly deposit volumes.

Traditional gaming companies, while initially hesitant, are now under increasing pressure to adapt. Many are exploring or actively integrating cryptocurrency payment options into their existing platforms, often developing hybrid models that accept both fiat and digital currencies. This shift requires significant investment in technology and a re-evaluation of regulatory compliance. The influence of crypto casinos is raising player expectations for speed, privacy, and control, compelling even established operators to innovate.

While the rise of crypto casinos broadly benefits the crypto market, certain tokens have seen a more direct impact. Bitcoin (BTC) remains the most popular cryptocurrency for gambling, though its dominance is gradually being challenged. Ethereum (ETH), Litecoin (LTC), Tether (USDT), and Dogecoin (DOGE) also consistently rank among the top choices. Notably, the share of altcoins in iGaming has seen a significant increase, rising from 25% in late 2023 to over 47% in late 2024. Furthermore, the emergence of casino-specific tokens, such as Rollbit's RLB and Shuffle's SHFL, is creating new market segments. These tokens are designed to enhance player engagement, offer staking rewards, and provide exclusive perks, adding a layer of utility and investment opportunity within the crypto gambling ecosystem. The primary demographic for these platforms remains younger, tech-savvy individuals, particularly those aged 25-34, who represent a significant portion of the user base.

The crypto community's response to the proliferation of cryptocurrency casinos is a tapestry of enthusiasm and apprehension. On social media platforms like Reddit, there's a growing acceptance and normalization of crypto gambling, particularly among tech-savvy users who laud the anonymity, faster transactions, and global accessibility. These discussions often highlight the technological advancements and the "provably fair" systems that offer a higher degree of transparency than traditional online casinos.

However, a significant undercurrent of concern persists, especially regarding responsible gambling and advertising ethics. Crypto influencers and live streamers, some with massive followings, have played a pivotal role in popularizing these platforms through sponsorships and affiliate marketing. While this boosts visibility, it also sparks "intense debate and scrutiny" over the ethics of promoting high-risk activities, especially when influencers are perceived to be gambling with casino-provided funds. Thought leaders and addiction experts often describe the crypto gambling landscape as a "Wild West" due to the fragmented regulatory oversight and potential for "degen" behavior, fueled by the inherent volatility of cryptocurrencies and the engaging nature of live-streamed gambling.

Within the broader Web3 ecosystem, crypto casinos are acting as a "real-time lab" for decentralized technologies. Decentralized Finance (DeFi) protocols are being integrated to enhance transparency through smart contracts, ensuring provably fair gaming with verifiable outcomes and lower house edges. This allows funds to remain in players' wallets until a bet is placed, mitigating risks associated with centralized control. Layer-2 scaling solutions (e.g., Arbitrum, Optimism) are increasingly adopted to combat high gas fees and network congestion on Ethereum (ETH), facilitating faster and cheaper transactions. Stablecoins are also gaining traction as a means to mitigate the volatility inherent in other cryptocurrencies.

Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) are also finding their place, functioning as in-game tokens, exclusive rewards, or elements in loyalty programs, enriching the user experience and blurring the lines between gaming and digital collectibles. Platforms like Decentraland (MANA) even host virtual casinos where NFT-based virtual land and assets can be traded. However, the integration of NFTs faces challenges related to regulatory clarity, AML/KYC compliance, and transaction fees. A recent YouTube policy update, effective November 17, 2025, has raised concerns among Web3 and NFT gaming creators, potentially classifying content promoting digital goods with real value as gambling violations, which could impact content discoverability. Ultimately, while crypto casinos drive innovation in Web3, they also contribute to the "gamblification of finance," where crypto platforms monetize user risk, blurring the lines between investing, speculating, and gambling, and raising concerns about consumer protection.

The trajectory of cryptocurrency casinos suggests a future of significant growth and deeper integration into both the crypto market and the broader online gambling industry. In the short term (1-2 years), we can expect crypto casinos to continue driving increased crypto adoption and liquidity, acting as a critical gateway for new users into the digital asset space. This will sustain demand for major cryptocurrencies and further diversify the usage of altcoins. However, this growth will be met with intensifying regulatory scrutiny, forcing projects to adapt to fragmented legal landscapes and potentially leading to more localized or crypto-friendly offerings. Technological refinement will be key, with ongoing advancements in Layer 2 scaling solutions, AI-driven personalization, and robust "provably fair" gaming protocols. The inherent volatility of cryptocurrencies will remain a short-term risk, necessitating robust risk management strategies for both platforms and individual investors. The emergence of hybrid casino models, accepting both fiat and crypto, will also intensify competition.

Looking further ahead (3-5+ years), crypto casinos are poised for mainstream integration, potentially capturing 35-40% of the global online gambling market by 2030. This will likely diminish the distinction between "crypto casinos" and traditional online gambling. Deeper integration with DeFi primitives will enable innovative models like decentralized betting pools and sophisticated tokenomics. The convergence with Web3 technologies could lead to immersive virtual reality (VR) casinos and metaverse-based gambling experiences. The long-term will also see the emergence of more specialized gambling-specific tokens and potentially the integration of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) by 2027. Regulatory frameworks are anticipated to become clearer and more standardized, fostering greater trust and attracting institutional capital. Market consolidation is also a likely trend, with major traditional gambling operators acquiring successful crypto-native platforms.

Key catalysts to watch include global regulatory clarity and harmonization, which would legitimize the sector and attract significant institutional investment. Technological breakthroughs in advanced provably fair mechanisms, scalability, AI, and mainstream metaverse/VR development will be crucial. The entry of traditional gaming giants fully embracing crypto operations would signal a major shift towards mainstream acceptance. Increased institutional investment, improved user experience, robust self-custody solutions, and the continued dominance and innovation of stablecoins will also accelerate growth.

For projects, strategic considerations include prioritizing regulatory compliance, investing heavily in technology, enhancing user experience, fostering trust through transparency, developing sustainable tokenomics, and forging strategic partnerships. Investors, on the other hand, must conduct thorough due diligence, assess regulatory risks, diversify investments, focus on strong fundamentals, monitor market trends, and implement robust risk management strategies, including setting stop-loss limits and taking strategic profits.

Possible scenarios include a highly likely "Mainstream Integration & Regulation" scenario, where crypto casinos become a well-regulated, legitimate, and substantial segment of the industry. A "Niche but Steadily Growing" scenario holds medium likelihood, where regulatory fragmentation persists. A "Regulatory Crackdown & Stagnation" scenario is low-to-medium likelihood, potentially triggered by high-profile fraud or market instability. Finally, a "Technological Disruption" scenario, with medium likelihood, could see entirely new paradigms of online gambling emerge from unforeseen advancements in blockchain, AI, or other emerging technologies.

The rise of cryptocurrency casinos, exemplified by 099.vip's recent upgrade, marks a pivotal moment for both the crypto and online gaming industries. The core appeal lies in the enhanced privacy, security, faster transactions, and verifiable fairness offered by blockchain technology. This sector is not merely a niche but a rapidly expanding force, driving crypto adoption, pushing Web3 innovation, and challenging traditional gaming models.

The long-term significance of crypto casinos extends beyond just gambling; they serve as a real-world testbed for decentralized technologies, demonstrating the practical application of smart contracts, stablecoins, and Layer 2 solutions. As regulatory frameworks slowly catch up, and as traditional gaming companies increasingly integrate crypto options, the lines between conventional and decentralized online gaming will continue to blur. This evolution suggests a future where crypto-powered experiences are a standard, expected feature for online entertainment.

For crypto investors and enthusiasts, the key takeaways are to recognize the immense growth potential of this sector, but also to remain vigilant about regulatory developments and market volatility. Projects with strong fundamentals, clear regulatory strategies, and a focus on user experience and technological innovation are likely to thrive. Important metrics to monitor include the global crypto gambling market share, the adoption rates of various cryptocurrencies within gaming platforms, and the progress of international regulatory harmonization. The ongoing integration of DeFi and NFTs into these platforms will also be a critical indicator of broader Web3 maturation.

This article is for informational purposes only and does not constitute financial or investment advice. Cryptocurrency investments carry significant risk.

Title: UN Launches Blockchain Training To Onboard Governments Globally
Description:
Four governments will be selected for initial collaboration, with formal approval expected within one to two weeks.

The United Nations Development Programme is set to launch blockchain education programs for government officials, alongside establishing an advisory body within weeks. Robert Pasicko, who leads UNDP's AltFinLab fintech team, announced the initiatives at UN City offices in Copenhagen.

UNDP research identified 300 potential government use cases for blockchain technology. The organization operates pilots in 20 countries focused on financial inclusion through cryptocurrency infrastructure, partnering with Decaf, a crypto-powered payment system enabling financial access without traditional banks.

Twenty-five leading blockchain companies discussed forming a UNDP-led advisory organization at the UN General Assembly in New York. Participants included Ethereum Foundation, Stellar Foundation, and Polygon Labs. Pasicko stated the project could launch within two to three months.

Pasicko compared banking infrastructure evolution to public phone booth decline, questioning whether ATMs will remain necessary within years. He expects a combination of cryptocurrencies, private stablecoins, and central bank digital currencies will reshape financial systems as different jurisdictions favor different solutions.

Technology eliminates traditional intermediaries, requiring only internet connectivity and smartphones for transactions. Pasicko emphasized that blockchain deployment could either widen wealth divides or serve the masses, depending on implementation approaches. Those currently in power are attempting to maintain control, but the technology's dual-use nature means outcomes depend on how governments and institutions choose to deploy blockchain solutions.

I'm a crypto writer and an environmental scientist.

Join the thousands already learning crypto!

Title: Can Crypto Tracing Technology Really Stop Crypto Scams?
Description:
Get magazine delivered to your doorstep

Get latest issue delivered instantly

Only in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Pune, Lucknow & Kolkata

Get magazine delivered to your doorstep

Get latest issue delivered instantly

Only in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Pune, Lucknow & Kolkata

The world of cryptocurrency has lately seen both unparalleled innovation and irresponsible use. The same concept that allows for borderless transfers, therefore enabling inclusivity into world finance, is one that lends anonymity-a haven for fraudsters and cybercriminals. In this day and age, with crypto scams seemingly on the rise, regulators and technologists have mobilized a remarkably powerful solution: crypto-tracing technology. But what is it? How does it work? And can it help make crypto safer for all?

Crypto tracing technology is a practice that involves the usage of different digital tools and software so as to trace and analyze flows of cryptocurrency transactions running on blockchains. Since most cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin and Ethereum, are operated on public ledgers, every transaction leaves a digital mark. Still, all this information is encrypted or pseudonymous, which makes it look secure and private.

Tracing tools decode this information to analyze it for any connection with wallet addresses, transaction patterns, and maybe real-world identities. Companies specializing in this field of work, such as Chainalysis, Elliptic, and CipherTrace, work with governments, exchanges, and law enforcement agencies to monitor illicit activity and detect crypto scams.

Crypto scams have been viewed as a threat to the entire ecosystem of digital assets. Their tactics change now and then, right from Ponzi schemes and fake initial coin offerings down to phishing attacks and rug pulls, as scams seek to exploit investor enthusiasm. The losses this kind of crypto operation has caused in the world in 2024 ran into billions of dollars.

One of the reasons scams succeed is the myth that cryptocurrencies are "untraceable." While it is true that users' names are not attached to wallet addresses, the transactions themselves are permanent and transparent. That's where tracing technology changes the game: by connecting those anonymous dots.

Consider the modus operandi of a scammer who cycles stolen crypto through numerous wallets in what is called "chain hopping." Tracing tools can track such movements, flag suspicious addresses, and alert the relevant authorities. The more sophisticated the tracing, the harder it is for criminals to hide.

To conceptualize how tracing works, think of the blockchain as a public highway. Each transaction occurring on it is a vehicle on the road, which leaves tire marks while it travels. Tracing technology does the job of a forensic investigator by gathering, analyzing, and mapping these marks to trace origin and destination.

It normally involves several steps:

Data Collection: Tracing systems gather transaction data from various blockchains

Address Clustering: This is a means of clustering similar addresses depending on their behavior and identifying the users or entities operating several wallets.

Risk Scoring: Each transaction or address is labeled with what's called a "risk score," depending on its connection to an already-identified scam, darknet market, or other suspicious behavior.

Entity Attribution: Analysts or AI models are able to match wallet data against real-world identities, especially at the point when scammers interact with regulated exchanges that require KYC information.

The following steps are instrumental in allowing investigators to trace the origin of crypto scams; in many cases, they recover funds or, at a minimum, identify wallets involved in the illicit activity.

Crypto tracing tools have become an integral part of the private and public sectors. The government uses this technology in the enforcement of AML and CTF laws, while exchanges use it to make sure they are not party to moving criminal money. Businesses and investors also use the tracing data to verify the legitimacy of a given crypto asset well before large trades.

It has been effective, for example, when the U.S. authorities recovered millions in Bitcoin from ransomware groups, something which wasn't possible without tracing technology following digital breadcrumbs across wallet layers to exchanges.

More important, though, is the fact that tracing acts to deter: the appeal of committing fraud in the first place diminishes when scammers realize their transactions can be monitored. This could, over time, greatly cut down on the number of crypto scams targeting unsuspecting investors.

However powerful, the technology raises questions about privacy and decentralization-two of the most important features upon which cryptocurrency was founded in the first place. To critics, too much surveillance undermines users' rights to anonymity in their financial dealings. In contrast, proponents would argue that some level of transparency is crucial in engendering trust and stability in the market.

Perhaps it comes down to a question of balance: using the tracing tools in such a manner as to prevent crypto scams and criminal misuse, while still protecting individual privacy. Newer systems do employ "selective transparency," whereby only authorized institutions can access sensitive information when this is legally required.

Standardized Evolving rapidly Interesting to note, in such a comparison, is how transparency in blockchain, combined with crypto tracing technology, can outdo traditional systems in fraud detection, provided it is used responsibly.

With growing crypto adoption, the technologies for tracing are bound to get more sophisticated. Artificial intelligence and machine learning improve their capabilities to enable predictive analytics that identify potential scams, even before they happen. Further integrations within regulatory frameworks, such as those proposed in the EU's MiCA and FATF's Travel Rule, will help further in the strengthening of crypto security on a global scale. With interoperability improving on the blockchain, tracing will continue well beyond Bitcoin and Ethereum to thousands of different digital assets and DeFi platforms. In the next few years, AI used in tandem with blockchain analytics could make crypto scams significantly more difficult to conduct and far easier to spot.

Crypto tracing technology brings a level of transparency, accountability, and safety to an industry that had previously been dominated by anonymity. Of course, it cannot put a complete stop to fraud, but it makes it much more difficult and dangerous for criminals. In any case, the goal is never to remove privacy from crypto but to make sure that with this further evolution, fairness goes hand in hand with trust. Accordingly, with the growth of the digital economy, so will the importance of tracing technologies in protecting investors and maintaining confidence in the future of cryptocurrency.

Q1. What is crypto tracing technology?

Crypto tracing technology is a digital means of tracking every cryptocurrency transaction in and across blockchains to help authorities and exchanges identify illegal or suspicious activities, including crypto scams.

Q2. How does crypto tracing help prevent scams?

 It analyzes the transaction data for patterns linked to fraudulent wallets or exchanges. Such early detection and flagging of such activities can help tracing tools in preventing the spread of crypto scams.

Q3. Is every cryptocurrency traceable?

Although most major cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin and Ethereum, are traceable due to their public ledgers, some privacy coins like Monero and Zcash make it hard to trace due to the obscuration of transactions.

Q4. Does crypto tracing invade user privacy?

Although tracing focuses on wallet addresses and transaction patterns, and not on personal data, the connection to regulated exchanges with implemented KYC verification allows tracing to link activities to real identities, raising pressing privacy concerns that are now being addressed through balanced regulation.

Q5. Can Tracing Technology completely stop crypto scams?

 It cannot totally eliminate scams, but instead, it has significantly reduced their success rate due to increased accountability and transparency. Used together with increased user awareness and regulatory oversight, this tracing technology has rendered crypto scams a lot weaker than before.

Title: Bitcoin Defi Gets Another Institutional Boost Through Anchorage Digital Custody
Description:
Cryptocurrency bank Anchorage Digital is opening institutional pathways into Bitcoin-native decentralized finance (DeFi), providing a regulated gateway to BOB's Bitcoin‚ÄìEthereum ecosystem.

The custody service provided by a U.S. federally-chartered bank could provide a boost for institutional participants seeking yield opportunities in BOB's $250 million total value locked (TVL) DeFi platform, according to an emailed announcement shared with CoinDesk on Friday.

Anchorage also holds a Major Payment Institution License (MPI) from the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) and provides a self-custody wallet called Porto.

BOB ("Build on Bitcoin") describes itself as a hybrid layer-2 network combining the security of Bitcoin and the DeFi capabilities of Ethereum, whereby users can use their BTC holdings to access yield opportunities in the broader blockchain ecosystem with Ethereum as the entry point. 

Anchorage providing custody services for BOB marks a step in making bitcoin BTC$102.012,68 yield opportunities accessible to institutions seeking secure and compliant infrastructure. The total value locked in true Bitcoin DeFi has surged from $200 million to over $8 billion in the past 18 months, according to DeFiLlama. 

However, that still represents just 0.3% of bitcoin's market capitalization. The expansion of regulated access points could catalyze greater growth as institutions look beyond passive BTC exposure to participate in yield-bearing DeFi activity.

"As smart contract capabilities mature, they unlock new applications that combine Bitcoin's security with fresh utility, and open the door for institutions and holders to participate in meaningful ways," Nathan McCauley, CEO of Anchorage Digital, said in Friday's announcement.

Title: Crypto Markets Today: Bitcoin (BTC) Defends $100K Price as Traders Flee Altcoins
Description:
The crypto market compounded a negative week with a continued drawdown on Friday. Bitcoin BTC$102,012.68 dropped to $100,600 and ether ETH$3,355.00 is languishing as $3,270.

The move appears to be in line with the wider crypto market trend of late, which has seen BTC lose 18% of its value over the past 30 days. Both the CoinDesk 5 Index (CD5) of the largest, most active tokens and the broader CoinDesk 20 Index (CD20) have lost about 3% in the past 24 hours.

The fallout can still be attributed to comments out of the Federal Reserve earlier in the week that suggested a potential cooling of the rate-cutting cycle, causing a rise in the U.S. dollar and a slump in risk assets.

The altcoin market, with the exception of AI tokens, is performing worse than bitcoin, with the "altcoin season" index at 22/100, its lowest in more than 90 days.

By Saksham Diwan

By Oliver Knight

Title: Bitcoin Weakness Sends a Warning to Stocks, but Liquidity May Soon Turn, Citi Says
Description:
Wall Street giant Citi (C) said the sluggish start to the traditional Santa Claus rally may not yet derail the year-end equity rebound but points to bitcoin's BTC$102,012.68 slump as a warning sign. 

Bitcoin's trading behavior has historically mirrored the Nasdaq 100's fortunes: when the cryptocurrency sits above its 55-day moving average, returns on the Nasdaq improve markedly, analysts led by Dirk Willer wrote in the Thursday report.

With bitcoin now below that threshold, the analysts said the equity market's risk-adjusted returns have weakened.

The bank's analysts attributed the recent crypto weakness largely to tightening liquidity conditions. The U.S. Treasury's rebuilding of its cash balance, combined with declining bank reserves, down roughly $500 billion since mid-July, has drained liquidity and pressured risk assets. 

The analysts noted that while equities had been resilient thanks to the artificial intelligence (AI) boom, bitcoin tends to react faster to shifts in liquidity. The good news, the report said, is that Treasury balances are now near levels where rebuilding has typically stopped, suggesting liquidity could soon improve and revive both bitcoin and stocks.

Still, Citi sees new concerns emerging around the AI trade. Investors are questioning whether massive AI spending will yield sufficient returns, even as companies face surging hardware costs and supply constraints reminiscent of the late 1990s.

Hyperscalers such as Meta (META) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are also turning to debt markets to fund data-center buildouts, issuing tens of billions of dollars in new bonds. The bank noted that this shift toward credit financing echoes the dot-com era, though balance sheets remain far stronger today. 

The report concluded that the debt issuance reflects opportunity rather than stress, but warned that the move from cash to credit is rarely a positive for bondholders.

Read more: Citi Says Crypto's Weakness Stems From Slowing ETF Flows and Fading Risk Appetite

Title: Michael Saylor's MSTR Adds $715M in BTC Buying Power in European Offering
Description:
Michael Saylor and team at Strategy (MSTR) have officially expanded across the pond as they seek to tap new funding markets in their quest to acquire even more bitcoin BTC$102,012.68.

The largest publicly traded company holding bitcoin, Strategy priced its initial public offering of 7.75 million shares of 10% Series A Perpetual Stream Preferred Stock (STRE) at ‚Ç¨80 per share. 

The sale, expected to close on Nov. 13, will generate approximately ‚Ç¨620 million ($715 million) in gross proceeds, per a Friday press release, with which the company will mostly acquire additional bitcoin.

The STRE Stock carries a 10% annual dividend on its ‚Ç¨100 stated value, payable quarterly beginning Dec. 31, when declared by the board. Unpaid dividends will accrue interest at an initial rate of 11%, rising by 1% per quarter up to 18% until paid.

Strategy is already the holder of 641,205 bitcoin worth roughly $64.1 billion at BTC's current price of about $100,000. In addition to recent declines in the price of bitcoin, the premium at which investors are pricing Strategy's common stock to the value of its bitcoin has been rapidly contracting. 

This crimps the company's ability to raise money via common stock sales, making these preferred issuances a favored avenue should the company want to continue to accumulate BTC.

MSTR shares are lower by another 5.3% premarket to just $225, now down by about 50% since peaking for 2025 less than four months ago.
